meanings.type: Godan verb with 'su' ending, Transitive verb
meanings.meaning: 1. to smash; to crush; to flatten 彼は私の帽子をぺちゃんこにつぶした。He squashed my hat flat.

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'su' ending, Transitive verb
meanings.meaning: 2. to shut down; to put out of business; to force (a company) to close up shop

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'su' ending, Transitive verb
meanings.meaning: 3. to wreck; to break; to block; to thwart 彼は平然と取引をつぶしました。He sank the deal without batting an eyelash.

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'su' ending, Transitive verb
meanings.meaning: 4. to butcher; to slaughter; to kill (livestock, for food)

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'su' ending, Transitive verb
meanings.meaning: 5. to kill (time); to while away (the time); to use up (one's time) 彼女は店を見てまわって１時間つぶした。She killed an hour looking around the stores.

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'su' ending, Transitive verb
meanings.meaning: 6. to waste (e.g. talents)

2. Ulcer (dermatology) An ulcer is a sore on the skin or a mucous membrane, acco... Read more
1. ulcer Medicine
2. Ulcer (dermatology) An ulcer is a sore on the skin or a mucous membrane, acco... Read more
1. to be crushed; to be squashed; to be smashed; to be destroyed; to be broken; to collapse 雪の重さで家がつぶれた。The house collapsed under the weight of snow.
2. to go bankrupt; to go under; to fail; to collapse
3. to be ruined (of a plan); to be cancelled; to collapse (e.g. of a project); to fall through; to blow up 父が亡くなって私の留学計画は完全につぶれた。My plan to study abroad went by the board when my father died.
4. to be lost (of one's voice, eyesight, sense of smell, etc.); to cease functioning
5. to be taken up (of one's time); to be lost; to be wasted
6. to be missed (of a chance); to be lost
7. to be lost (of face, composure, etc.); to broken down (e.g. of one's courage); to be broken (of one's heart)
8. to be worn down (of a pen nib, saw teeth, etc.); to wear away; to become dull
9. to get dead drunk See also 飲みつぶれる
1. to be crushed; to be squashed; to be smashed; to be destroyed; to be broken; to collapse 雪の重さで家がつぶれた。The house collapsed under the weight of snow.
2. to go bankrupt; to go under; to fail; to collapse
3. to be ruined (of a plan); to be cancelled; to collapse (e.g. of a project); to fall through; to blow up 父が亡くなって私の留学計画は完全につぶれた。My plan to study abroad went by the board when my father died.
4. to be lost (of one's voice, eyesight, sense of smell, etc.); to cease functioning
5. to be taken up (of one's time); to be lost; to be wasted
6. to be missed (of a chance); to be lost
7. to be lost (of face, composure, etc.); to broken down (e.g. of one's courage); to be broken (of one's heart)
8. to be worn down (of a pen nib, saw teeth, etc.); to wear away; to become dull
9. to get dead drunk See also 飲みつぶれる

sentences.translation: The house collapsed under the weight of snow.
My plan to study abroad went by the board when my father died.

2. eye poke (in combat sports); eye-gouging See also サミング「軽くならいいけど」「うむ、では金的と目潰しは有効にするか？」"If it's a light workout, OK." "Right, so will we allow crotch-kicking and eyeball crushing?"
